threads.title: Vancouver citation style guide
threads.excerpt:
# Vancouver citation style guide

**Date:** 2025-09-05

---

**User:** Hey Fred, How can I describe the Vancouver Citation style for an AI agent to use it in referencing researched articles and websit

threads.title: 📘 Reference List Format
threads.excerpt:
Use commas for non-sequential (e.g. `[2,5,9]`) and dashes for ranges (e.g. `[3–6]`)

---

## 📘 Reference List Format

Each reference entry begins with its citation number, followed by a period and a

threads.title: 📘 Reference List Formatting
threads.excerpt:
- Use commas for separate entries: `[1,3,5]`
  - Use a dash for consecutive sources: `[2–4]`
- Always match the in-text number with its corresponding number in the reference list.

---

threads.title: Users can enable the syncing of GitHub comments...
threads.excerpt:
Users can enable the syncing of GitHub comments to Notion and toggle linkbacks from Notion tasks back to GitHub, providing comprehensive context and navigation between platforms.

learnings.details:
Year;Volume(Issue):Page range. Year [cited YYYY Mon DD];Volume(Issue):Page range. Under **Permissions**, enable:
   - `Contents`: ✅ Read and write
   - (Optional) `Issues`: ✅ Read and write (if you want me to create issues/todos)
   - DO NOT enable anything else unless you want me to manage secrets, workflows, etc

learnings.details:
Confirm on GitHub
Visit your repo on GitHub and confirm that:

✅ The file appears  
✅ It’s in the correct folder  
✅ Commit history reflects the new file

---

If you’d prefer me to generate a CLI script for you (or a VS Code snippet), just say the word — I can package it all up with copy-ready code!

**User:** No please step me through how I give you access to store /fetch code from my Github Desktop? I need to understanbd these new tools you've introduced me to

**Assistant:** Thanks Carla — this is a great step forward in building out your local-first automation approach via **GitHub Desktop + Codespaces + OpenMemory**
